column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=4. Discussion
#Text=Nurses play a major role in managing patients , and the nature of their work exposes them to back pain .
#Text=In the present study , the one-year prevalence of LBP among the nurses working in public hospitals was 74.8 % .
#Text=The finding is almost similar to the study among the nurses in Switzerland , which ranged from 73 % to 76 % .
#Text=It is also in line with the studies in Kuwait , Tunisia , and Nepal .
#Text=However , the prevalence was lower in developed countries such as Canada , Ireland , and Japan .
#Text=The prevalence of LBP among nurses may differ between developed and developing countries , within countries , and across the region .

#Text=The differences of the findings could be due to the difference in the research methodology , questionnaire used , history of back pain among nurses , and self-report of the disease having a pattern of recurrence and reduction .
#Text=On top of that , the application of back hygiene policy and workplace interventions also play a major role in the differences .

#Text=Despite the modernization of the health care system , the studies in Taiwan and South Africa reported that the lifetime prevalence of LBP among nurses working in hospitals was 82 % and 84 % , respectively .
#Text=It indicates that regardless of the modernization status of the country , pain could occur if there were no preventive measures taken while working .
#Text=The present study shows that working hours play a significant role in the development of LBP .
#Text=It was found that those who work more than seven hours a day were at risk of LBP as compared to others .
#Text=It can be due to the repetitive exposure to excessive work , such as lifting a heavy object , which leads to injury to the lower back region .
#Text=Furthermore , sometimes they need to work a few hours more covering for their colleagues on emergency leave or when there is lack of manpower .
#Text=This is in line with a study in Jeddah , Saudi Arabia , which describes that nurses who worked more than 10 hours a day had an increased risk of LBP compared to those who did not .
#Text=In addition , Shieh et al. described that the risk of LBP increases by 35 % for every additional daily working hour .
#Text=As a result , it was suggested that the work schedule of nurses needs to be relooked into , as it plays a significant role in the development of back pain .
#Text=Nurses usually worked longer than their normal schedule because of the shortage of registered nurses .
#Text=With a big ratio between nurses and patients , the risks of making errors were significantly increased .
#Text=Fatigue is one of the symptoms that arises because of work exhaustion , which can contribute to accidents and injuries at the workplace .
#Text=On top of that , it was reported that the incidence of LBP is increased with an increase in working hours .
#Text=In addition , a study found that prolonged working hours exposed nurses to repeated manual handling and , thus , sustained the accumulation of wears and tears of the back muscles .
#Text=Another important factor in the development of LBP is manual handling performed by nurses .
#Text=Many nurses in Malaysia are still required to manually lift patients from one place or one position to another .
#Text=All nurses in Malaysia are required to use small aids like sliding sheets to move patients in the hospitals .
#Text=However , the present study found a significant association between manual handling and LBP .
#Text=The repetitive work exposes them to injuries , especially in the lumbar area .
#Text=It is caused by the kinetic imbalance and pressure exerted on this area .
#Text=The repeated load application by lifting a patient may result in cumulative fatigue and reduction in the stress-bearing capacity of nurses .
#Text=Apart from lifting patients , nurses often conduct patient handling by bending their waists and maintaining an uncomfortable posture toward the opposite side of the bed or chair .
#Text=This position increases the risk of back pain .
#Text=This is supported by a study in the Netherlands and Iran , which found that the bending position increases the risk of back pain .
#Text=However , in the present study , the bending position was not significantly associated with the development of LBP .
#Text=This difference could be due to the recall bias of the respondents .
#Text=Nurses frequently need to twist their bodies while handling patients .
#Text=In the present study , this has a significant association with LBP .
#Text=This is in line with the studies in India and Brazil , which found that twisting of the body was associated with LBP .
#Text=On top of that , back muscle fatigue is found to be strongly associated with decreased postural stability especially in standing position .
#Text=The present study revealed that there was a significant association between fatigue and LBP .
#Text=This can be explained by the negative influence of fatigue on the muscle receptors and thereby on proprioception .
